page.title: 07FARMING (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content: There are 11 farms and a Market Garden in our area. {The main crop grown is barley,}mostly for animal feeding. Other crops grown are wheat, oil seed rape, and grass for silage and hay. {For over a hundred years hops have {been grown}at West End Farm, picked each Autumn by visiting 'travellers' and dried in a kiln on the farm. This is the last year, however, as there are different Common Market rules for the kind of hops grown, so the English hops aren't wanted. Grass is grown from special seed but there is also rough grazing for sheep at West End and cows at Saintbury. The{sheep}are bred for meat but the Friesian{cows}are kept for milk.
